intro: Paraeremostachys persimilis, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces spikes of pale purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
